basics.name: Santiago Espinosa Mooser
basics.summary: Hi there ðŸ‘‹ My name is Santiago. I'm a 25y/o DevSecOps engineer with a background in Computer Science. I mainly do security work, but I'm a technical generalist with strong automation skills. I mainly like to work with linux and linux-adjacent technologies but also enjoy infrastructure and DevOps work. I've worked in several different roles, including as a DevSecOps Engineer, Penetration Tester, and WebApp Developer. My focus over the past couple of years has been learning about technologies I'm interested in (Kubernetes, Rust, Linux) and in general improving my technical knowledge. I'm a very curious person and as such have experimented with many different technologies; This includes but is not limited to building and hosting my own Proxmox server at home, running Arch Linux as my main OS, and developing my own containerized services in Docker. I like to work with a technical team that I can rely on and love to be the least knowledgeable person in the room. However, I'm also more than happy to help mentor and guide others where I can. If you're interested in my work, please feel free to check out my github and/or contact me using my email in the top right!

work.name: Hex Trust
work.description: Hex Trust is a fully-licensed provider of bank-grade custody for digital assets with a focus on security and compliance.
work.summary: After graduating, I got a permanent offer from HexTrust to work as their in-house DevSecOps Engineers, where I focused on improving our security monitoring and hardening the cloud-based workloads.
highlights: Maintained, deployed and managed Privileged Access Management (PAM) tool (teleport) by provisioning and managing access to our kubernetes clusters, RDS databases, web applications and linux servers using terragrunt, helm charts and AWS EKS.
Developed, used and maintained terraform modules to provision and maintain cloud resources in AWS such as EKS roles, IAM roles and teleport roles.
Organized, launched, and ran private bug-bounty programme for our services. Responded to reports and coordinated fixes.
Deployed CSPM tool and improved alerting to improve our security monitoring
Served as a security advocate in the company to improve security practices.
Acted as main contact for security-related incidents. Responded to incidents and documented response in incidence reports.
Managed interests of stakeholders in other departments to ensure both security and business needs were met.
Misc work such as automating small tasks for team members, helping with difficult IT tickets and investigating non-security issues with infrastructure.

work.name: Hex Trust
work.description: Hex Trust is a fully-licensed provider of bank-grade custody for digital assets with a focus on security and compliance.
work.summary: Got head-hunted into an internship and continued working part-time throughout the last year of my studies. Focused on shiftin security left by delivering several projects that improved security reporting in the company.
highlights: Designed, implemented, and maintained the company's first-ever DevSecOps pipeline, preventing vulnerable code, secrets, and dependencies from reaching production using Snyk, tfsec, Clair, and trufflehog, as well as other SAST tools. Adapted CICD rules based on the company's Git branching strategy.
Personally led the Snyk vulnerability management tool implementation, achieving a 20% reduction in active, potentially exploitable vulnerabilities within the first month.

Deployed and maintained next-gen WAF (Signal Sciences) to protect against OWASP Top-10, various web CVEs, and enumeration attacks. The project led to increased protection as well as visibility into incoming network attacks. The ruleset was managed through Terraform Infrastructure as Code (IAC) for increased reproducibility and control.
Automated provisioning of company Yubikeys, reducing provisioning time from ~45 minutes to <1 minute. The open-source scripts can be found on my GitHub.
Led the adoption of YubiKey hardware smartcards for company-wide code signing, significantly enhancing security measures across the organization.
Conducted thorough investigations on critical security incidents by analyzing logs and alerts from the company's SIEM and WAF systems, and provided recommendations to the Head of Cybersecurity.
Collaborated with Head of Cybersecurity to evaluate and test next-generation WAF/RASP and automated pentesting tools.

work.name: Handshake Networking
work.description: Handshake Networking is a boutique cybersecurity consultancy company that specializes in penetration testing and application security testing.
work.summary: Started as a internship, then deferred a semester to work in various roles (due to the small size of the company): Pentesting, Automation Engineering, Web Development, System Engineering.
highlights: Designed, developed, and deployed a Python-based Django backend API to automatically scan vessels worldwide using remote scanners, RabbitMQ queues, and asynchronous Celery tasks.

Managed and maintained company servers and VMs, facilitating the deployment and utilization of internal services such as Bookstack, Samba, Elasticsearch, Microsoft Domain Controller, and Microsoft Remote app server.

Compiled an Elasticsearch-based database containing over 4.2 billion records of publicly available leaked credentials to enhance penetration testing quality and increase the success rate of brute-forcing client passwords.
Assisted in the re-certification process for the Authorized Scanning Vendor PCI certificate by automating reconnaissance and reporting stages.
Deployed Docker-based internal services, including Bookstack (an internal wiki), GitLab, and an Ubuntu-based Samba server.
Developed various internal automation tools and web applications, such as an ike-scan and nmap multithreaded wrapper (available on GitHub).
Marketing Secretary (2021-2022, 2022-2023) for the Computer Science Association
Lead organizer for the HKU Computer Science Society's Virtual Career Week 2022.

projects.name: Self-hosted Server
projects.description: Deployed a proxmox-based server for personal self-hosting and media and data backup. In this server, I host various Docker-based services such as PhotoPrism, MonicaHQ and Firefly III.

projects.name: Yubikey provisioning scripts
projects.description: Automated the provisioning of Yubikeys' GPG applet to enable enforcing code singning by developers. Check my Github for more details.

projects.name: DevSecOps pipeline
projects.description: Implemented DAST, SAST, and secure stages for NodeJS projects to enhance early detection of security vulnerabilities. Adapted each environment pipeline to its corresponding development environment, using tools such as Snyk, Zap Scanner, tfsec, Hadolint, JSLint, Sonarqube, and Sigstore.

projects.name: Ansible-based automation for server provisioning
projects.description: Developed Ansible playbooks for provisioning PWC's servers using Ansible, Jinja2, and Bash scripting, reducing provisioning time from 4-5 business days to 30-45 minutes.

projects.name: Django-based network scanner API
projects.description: Designed, developed, and deployed a Django-based API for scanning vessels connected to satellite and 4G networks using asynchronous, pluggable 'scan engines' that communicate via RabbitMQ queues.

projects.name: Haskell-based interpreter
projects.description: Developed a custom programming language interpreter using Haskell for a Principles of Programming Languages Course, incorporating features like First-class Functions, Variable Scoping, Monads, and Mutable States. See https://github.com/santiago-mooser/haskell-based-interpreter.git

projects.name: Computer Science Association Virtual Career Week 2022
projects.description: Organized and led the 2022 virtual career week event for the Computer Science Association, hosting six speakers from various roles and serving as a host for three fireside talks
